intro: Pappophorum nigricans, commonly known as the blackseed grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its dark-colored seeds and slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a slightly hairy texture. Pappophorum nigricans is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
